sen.j: 横井 小楠（よこい しょうなん、男性、文化 (元号)6年8月13日 (旧暦)（1809年9月22日） - 明治2年1月5日 (旧暦)（1869年2月15日））は日本の武士･熊本藩士､儒学者。
sen.e: Shonan YOKOI (male, September 22, 1809 - February 15, 1869) is a samurai, feudal retainer of Kumamoto Domain and Confucian.
Shonan YOKOI (male, September 22, 1809 - February 15, 1869) is a samurai, feudal retainer of Kumamoto Domain and Confucian.
Shonan YOKOI (male, September 22, 1809 - February 15, 1869) is a samurai, feudal retainer of Kumamoto Domain and Confucian.

sen.j: 同志社第3代総長で政治家の横井時雄は長男。
sen.e: He is the third president of the Doshisha, and Tokio YOKOI of a statesperson is his first son.
Tokio YOKOI, who was the third president of the Doshisha and a statesperson is his first son.
sen.cmt: 誤訳と思われるため全面的に書き換えました。
sen.e: Tokio YOKOI, who was the third president of the Doshisha and a statesperson is his first son.

sen.j: 本姓は平氏。
sen.e: His original family name is Taira.
His original family name is Taira.
His original family name is Taira.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 文化6年（1809年）、肥後熊本（現在の熊本県）に、熊本藩藩士の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1809, he was born as the second son of a feudal retainer of Kumamoto Domain in Kumamoto, Higo (current Kumamoto Prefecture).
In 1809, he was born as the second son of a feudal retainer of Kumamoto Domain in Kumamoto, Higo (current Kumamoto Prefecture).
In 1809, he was born as the second son of a feudal retainer of Kumamoto Domain in Kumamoto, Higo (current Kumamoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 「小楠」は、彼が使った号の一つ。
sen.e: Shonan' is one of the go (pen name) that he used.
Shonan' is one of the second names that he used.
sen.cmt: go (pen name) →second namesに変更しました。
sen.e: Shonan' is one of the second names that he used.

sen.j: 諱は「時存」（「ときひろ」「ときあり」）であり、正式な名のりは平時存(たいら の ときひろ/ときあり)。
sen.e: His imina (posthumous name) is '時存' ('Tokihiro' or 'Tokiari') and his formal nanori (self-introduction, announcement of candidature) is TAIRA no Tokihiro/Tokiari.
His imina (posthumous name) is '時存' ('Tokihiro' or 'Tokiari') and his formal nanori (self-introduction, announcement of candidature) is TAIRA no Tokihiro/Tokiari.
His imina (posthumous name) is '時存' ('Tokihiro' or 'Tokiari') and his formal nanori (self-introduction, announcement of candidature) is TAIRA no Tokihiro/Tokiari.

sen.j: 通称は「平四郎」で、北条平四郎時存、北条四郎平時存ともいう。
sen.e: His common name is 'TAIRA no Shiro' and he was also called HOJO TAIRA no Shiro Tokihiro/Tokiari or HOJO Shiro TAIRA no Tokihiro/Tokiari.
His common name is 'TAIRA no Shiro' and he was also called HOJO TAIRA no Shiro Tokihiro/Tokiari or HOJO Shiro TAIRA no Tokihiro/Tokiari.
His common name is 'TAIRA no Shiro' and he was also called HOJO TAIRA no Shiro Tokihiro/Tokiari or HOJO Shiro TAIRA no Tokihiro/Tokiari.

sen.j: 横井家は平氏北条氏嫡流得宗に発する。
sen.e: The Yokoi family derives from the Taira clan and the main branch of the Hojo clan.
The Yokoi family derives from the Taira clan and the main branch of the Hojo clan.
The Yokoi family derives from the Taira clan and the main branch of the Hojo clan.

sen.j: 北条高時の遺児北条時行の子が尾張国愛知郡 (愛知県)横江村に住し、時行4世孫にあたる横江時利の子が、横井に改めたのがはじまり。
sen.e: The origin is that a son of Takatoki HOJO's bereaved son Tokiyuki HOJO moved to Yokoe village, Aichi District, Owari Province (current Aichi Prefecture), and a child of Tokitoshi YOKOE, equivalent to a great-grandchild of Tokiyuki, changed his name to Yokoi.
sen.cmt: 横江時利：読み方不明です。Tokitoshi YOKOE にしました。
sen.e: The origin is that a son of Takatoki HOJO's bereaved son Tokiyuki HOJO moved to Yokoe village, Aichi District, Owari Province (current Aichi Prefecture), and a child of Tokitoshi YOKOE, equivalent to a great-grandchild of Tokiyuki, changed his name to Yokoi.

The origin is that a son of Takatoki HOJO's bereaved son Tokiyuki HOJO moved to Yokoe village, Aichi District, Owari Province (current Aichi Prefecture), and a child of Tokitoshi YOKOE, equivalent to a great-grandchild of Tokiyuki, changed his name to Yokoi.

sen.j: 時利の子は横井時永といい、その子孫は横井時勝、横井時延、横井時泰、横井時安---と続いた。
sen.e: The son of Tokitoshi is Tokinaga YOKOI, and his descendants continued into Tokikatsu YOKOI (横井時勝), Tokinobu YOKOI (横井時延), Tokiyasu YOKOI (横井時泰), Tokiyasu YOKOI (横井時安) and so on.
The son of Tokitoshi is Tokinaga YOKOI, and his descendants continued into Tokikatsu YOKOI (横井時勝), Tokinobu YOKOI (横井時延), Tokiyasu YOKOI (横井時泰), Tokiyasu YOKOI (横井時安) and so on.
The son of Tokitoshi is Tokinaga YOKOI, and his descendants continued into Tokikatsu YOKOI (横井時勝), Tokinobu YOKOI (横井時延), Tokiyasu YOKOI (横井時泰), Tokiyasu YOKOI (横井時安) and so on.

sen.j: 北条氏の子孫として代々祖先の通字であった「時」の字を名乗りに用いる。
sen.e: As descendants of the Hojo clan, they used the Chinese character of '時' which was the tsuji (distinctive character used in the names of all people belonging to a single clan or lineage) of their ancestors for generations.

As descendants of the Hojo clan, they used the Chinese character of '時' which was the tsuji (distinctive character used in the names of all people belonging to a single clan or lineage) of their ancestors for generations.

As descendants of the Hojo clan, they used the Chinese character of '時' which was the tsuji (distinctive character used in the names of all people belonging to a single clan or lineage) of their ancestors for generations.

sen.j: 小楠は私塾「四時軒」（しじけん）を開き、多くの門弟を輩出した。
sen.e: Shonan opened a private school 'Shijiken' and developed a lot of disciples.
Shonan opened a private school 'Shijiken' and educated a lot of disciples.
Shonan opened a private school 'Shijiken' and educated a lot of disciples.

sen.j: また、坂本龍馬や井上毅など、明治維新の立役者やのちの明治新政府の中枢の多くもここを訪問している。
sen.e: Also, the key players of the Meiji Restoration such as Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kowashi INOUE and a number of later pivotal members of the New Meiji Government visited there.
Also, the key players of the Meiji Restoration such as Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kowashi INOUE and a number of later pivotal members of the New Meiji Government visited there.
Also, the key players of the Meiji Restoration such as Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kowashi INOUE and a number of later pivotal members of the New Meiji Government visited there.

sen.j: 松平慶永の政治顧問として招かれ、福井藩の藩政改革、さらには幕府の政事総裁職であった春嶽の助言者として幕政改革にかかわる。
sen.e: Invited as politics adviser to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, he engaged in the reformation of domain duties of Fukui Domain and also the reformation of the shogunate government as adviser to Shungoku who was the president of political affairs of bakufu.

Invited as politics adviser to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, he engaged in the reformation of domain duties of Fukui Domain and also the reformation of the shogunate government as adviser to Shungoku, who was the president of political affairs of bakufu.
sen.cmt: Shungokuの後にカンマを追加しました。
sen.e: Invited as politics adviser to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, he engaged in the reformation of domain duties of Fukui Domain and also the reformation of the shogunate government as adviser to Shungoku, who was the president of political affairs of bakufu.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）新政府に参与として出仕するが、翌年参内の帰途、十津川郷士らにより、京都寺町通丸太町通下ル東側（現在の京都市中京区）で暗殺される。
sen.e: In 1868, he attended at the New Government as Sanyo (Counselor), however, he was assassinated in Higashigawa, Marutamachi-dori Street Sagaru, Teramachi-dori Street, Kyoto (current Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City) by samurais from Totsugawa area on the way back from sandai (a visit to the Imperial Palace).

In 1868, he attended at the New Government as Sanyo (Counselor), however, he was assassinated in Higashigawa, Marutamachi-dori Street Sagaru, Teramachi-dori Street, Kyoto (current Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City) by samurais from Totsugawa area on the way back from sandai (a visit to the Imperial Palace).

In 1868, he attended at the New Government as Sanyo (Counselor), however, he was assassinated in Higashigawa, Marutamachi-dori Street Sagaru, Teramachi-dori Street, Kyoto (current Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City) by samurais from Totsugawa area on the way back from sandai (a visit to the Imperial Palace).

sen.j: 享年61。
sen.e: He was at the age of 61.
He was at the age of 61.
He was at the age of 61.

sen.j: 殺害の理由は「横井が開国を進めて日本をキリスト教化しようとしている」といった事実無根なものであったと言われている。
sen.e: The reason of the killing is complete fabrication that 'Yokoi is driving Japan to open to the world and Christianize the country'.
The reason of the killing is said to have been complete fabrication that 'Yokoi is driving Japan to open to the world and Christianize the country'.
sen.cmt: said to have been を追加しました。
sen.e: The reason of the killing is said to have been complete fabrication that 'Yokoi is driving Japan to open to the world and Christianize the country'.

sen.j: しかも弾正台の古賀十郎ら新政府の開国政策に不満を持つ保守派が裁判において横井が書いたとする『天道覚明書』という偽書を作成して横井が秘かに皇室転覆を企てたとする容疑で告発するなど、大混乱に陥った。
sen.e: In addition, a great confusion was caused, for example, the conservatives who were dissatisfied with the policy of "opening of the country" of the New Government, including Juro KOGA of Danjodai (Board of Censors), created so-called "Yokoi-written" apocryphal book named "Tendo Kakumei Sho" to accuse Yokoi at the trial of plotting secretly to overthrow the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 天道覚明書：読み方不明です。
sen.e: In addition, a great confusion was caused, for example, the conservatives who were dissatisfied with the policy of "opening of the country" of the New Government, including Juro KOGA of Danjodai (Board of Censors), forged a book named "Tendo Kakumei" and attributed it to Yokoi to accuse him of plotting secretly to overthrow the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 天道覚明書：読み方不明です。Created so-called "Yokoi-written" apocryphal book named "Tendo Kakumei Sho" →forged a book named "Tendo Kakumei" and attributed it to YokoiYokoi at the trial → him に変更しました。
sen.e: In addition, a great confusion was caused, for example, the conservatives who were dissatisfied with the policy of "opening of the country" of the New Government, including Juro KOGA of Danjodai (Board of Censors), forged a book named "Tendo Kakumei" and attributed it to Yokoi to accuse him of plotting secretly to overthrow the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 紆余曲折の末、実行者であった十津川郷士ら4名が明治3年に処刑される事となった。
sen.e: Despite a number of setbacks, 4 samurais from Totsugawa area who killed Shonan were executed in 1870.
Despite a number of setbacks, 4 samurais from Totsugawa area who killed Shonan were executed in 1870.
Despite a number of setbacks, 4 samurais from Totsugawa area who killed Shonan were executed in 1870.

sen.j: 人物
sen.e: Personal Profile
Personal Profile
Personal Profile

sen.j: 鎖国体制・幕藩体制を批判し、それに代わり得るあたらしい国家と社会の構想を「公共」と「交易」の立場から模索した。
sen.e: He criticized national isolation and shogunate system, and groped for alternative concept for new state and society from a point of view of 'public' and 'commerce'.
He criticized national isolation and the shogunate system, and groped for alternative concepts for new state and society from a point of view of 'public' and 'commerce'.
sen.cmt: the をshogunateの前に追加し、conceptと複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: He criticized national isolation and the shogunate system, and groped for alternative concepts for new state and society from a point of view of 'public' and 'commerce'.

sen.j: 小楠は、「公共」性・「公共」圏を実現するために、「講習討論」「朋友講学」といった身分階層を超えた討議を政治運営のもっとも重要な営為として重視した。
sen.e: Shonan emphasized the debate such as 'Koshu Toron' and 'Meiho Kogaku', which were beyond status hierarchy, as most important agency for the management of politics to represent 'public' nature and 'public' area.

Shonan emphasized the debate such as 'Koshu Toron' and 'Meiho Kogaku', which were beyond status hierarchy, as the most important agency for the management of politics to represent 'public' nature and 'public' area.
sen.cmt: theをmostの前に追加しました。
sen.e: Shonan emphasized the debate such as 'Koshu Toron' and 'Meiho Kogaku', which were beyond status hierarchy, as the most important agency for the management of politics to represent 'public' nature and 'public' area.

sen.j: また、「交易」を重視する立場から、外国との通商貿易をすすめ、産業の振興をも「交易」として捉えて国内における自律的な経済発展の方策を建議し、そのために幕府・藩を越えた統一国家の必要性を説いた。
sen.e: In addition, from his position of emphasizing 'commerce', he push forward overseas trade, and suggested the domestic scheme of autonomous development of industry with looking on the development of industry also as 'commerce', and for this, advocated the necessity of united nation beyond bukufu and han.

In addition, from his position of emphasizing 'commerce', he pushed forward overseas trade, and suggested the domestic scheme of autonomous development of industry looking on the development of industry also as 'commerce', and for this, advocated the necessity of united nation beyond bakufu and han.
sen.cmt: pushを過去形に修正しました。With削除しました。Bukufuをbakufuに修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, from his position of emphasizing 'commerce', he pushed forward overseas trade, and suggested the domestic scheme of autonomous development of industry looking on the development of industry also as 'commerce', and for this, advocated the necessity of united nation beyond bakufu and han.

sen.j: 体系的に小楠の国家論が提示された文書として、万延元年（1860年）に越前国福井藩の藩政改革のために執筆された「国是三論」がある。
sen.e: As a written material which systematically presents Shonan's theory of nation, there is 'Kokuze Sanron' (the Three Major Discussion of State Policy) written for the reformation of domain duties of Fukui Domain, Echigo Province in 1860.

As a written material which systematically presents Shonan's theory of nation, there is 'Kokuze Sanron' (the Three Major Discussion of State Policy) written for the reformation of domain duties of Fukui Domain, Echigo Province in 1860.

As a written material which systematically presents Shonan's theory of nation, there is 'Kokuze Sanron' (the Three Major Discussion of State Policy) written for the reformation of domain duties of Fukui Domain, Echigo Province in 1860.

sen.j: そのほか、学問と政治のむすびつきを論じた嘉永5年（1852年）執筆の「学校問答書」、マシュー・ペリーやエフィム・プチャーチンへの対応についての意見書である嘉永6年（1853年）執筆の「夷虜応接大意」、元治元年（1864年）の井上毅との対話の記録「沼山対話」、慶応元年（1865年）の元田永孚との対話の記録「沼山閑話」などがある。
sen.e: There are more written materials such as 'Gakko Mondo Sho' written in 1852 discussing about the relationship between academia and politics, 'Iryo Osetsu Taii', an opinion about Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY and Evfimiy Vasil' evich Putyatin, in 1853, 'Shozan Taiwa', the record of dialogue with Kowashi INOUE, in 1864 and 'Shozan Kanwa', the record of dialogue with Nagazane MOTODA, in 1865.

There are more written materials such as 'Gakko Mondo Sho' written in 1852 discussing about the relationship between academia and politics, 'Iryo Osetsu Taii', an opinion about Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY and Evfimiy Vasil' evich Putyatin, in 1853, 'Shozan Taiwa', the record of dialogue with Kowashi INOUE, in 1864 and 'Shozan Kanwa', the record of dialogue with Nagazane MOTODA, in 1865.

There are more written materials such as 'Gakko Mondo Sho' written in 1852 discussing about the relationship between academia and politics, 'Iryo Osetsu Taii', an opinion about Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY and Evfimiy Vasil' evich Putyatin, in 1853, 'Shozan Taiwa', the record of dialogue with Kowashi INOUE, in 1864 and 'Shozan Kanwa', the record of dialogue with Nagazane MOTODA, in 1865.

sen.j: 共和制（大統領制）の事を「尭舜の世（禅譲）」と評した事でも知られる。
sen.e: He is also known for describing republican institutions (presidential system) as 'the reign of Yao Shun (peaceful transfer of power)'.
He is also known for describing republican institutions (presidential system) as 'the reign of Yao Shun (peaceful transfer of power)'.
He is also known for describing republican institutions (presidential system) as 'the reign of Yao Shun (peaceful transfer of power)'.
